net.sf.sprockets.database.sqlite

Class DbOpenHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper
      • net.sf.sprockets.database.sqlite.DbOpenHelper

  • public class DbOpenHelper
extends SQLiteOpenHelper
    SQLiteOpenHelper that executes raw resource SQL scripts to create and upgrade the database. By default, the R.raw.create_tables and R.raw.upgrade_tables_vX resources will be used, where X is the version of the database that is being upgraded. You can also specify custom raw resource names with the overloaded constructors.

    For example, if the database is currently at version 2 and a user installs an app update that requires database version 4, and the default upgradeResBaseName of "upgrade_tables_v" is being used, then the R.raw.upgrade_tables_v2 and R.raw.upgrade_tables_v3 scripts will be executed to bring the existing database up to the version 4 schema.

    All statements in the resource scripts must end with a semicolon. If you have a nested statement that ends with a semicolon, such as when creating a trigger, you can add an empty comment after the nested statement semicolon, so that the unfinished outer statement is not executed at that point. For example: 

    CREATE TRIGGER foo_updated AFTER UPDATE ON foo
 BEGIN
     UPDATE foo SET bar = 'baz' WHERE _id = OLD._id;--
 END;

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description

      Use the default create and upgrade resources, R.raw.create_tables and R.raw.upgrade_tables_vX.

      Use the raw resources for the create and upgrade scripts.
      DbOpenHelper(Context context, String name, SQLiteDatabase.CursorFactory factory, int version, DatabaseErrorHandler errorHandler, int createResId, String upgradeResBaseName)
      Use a custom CursorFactory and/or DatabaseErrorHandler.

      • DbOpenHelper

        public DbOpenHelper(Context context,
            String name,
            int version,
            int createResId,
            String upgradeResBaseName)
        Use the raw resources for the create and upgrade scripts. See the class description for how upgradeResBaseName is used.
        Parameters:
        createResId - can be 0 to use the default resource name
        upgradeResBaseName - can be null to use the default resource name
        See Also:
        SQLiteOpenHelper.SQLiteOpenHelper(Context, String, SQLiteDatabase.CursorFactory, int)
